main.name: Kobee Raveendran
main.contactmessage: If you'd like to reach me for any reason, feel free to use any of the mediums below.

resume.skillmessage: Here are some of my technical skills and familiar frameworks, ranked by proficiency.

education.degree: Master of Science in Computer Science
Bachelor of Science in Computer Science, Mathematics Minor

work.title: Software Engineering Fellow
work.description: Member of the MLH Fellowship's Fall 2020 cohort, in which I was selected as one of ~160 out of 10,000+ applicants. My 3-member pod, backed by the U.S. Department of Defense, is working on developing an NLP-based learning solution for members of the U.S. Navy to practice voice commands.

work.title: Undergraduate Researcher
work.description: Worked under Dr. Yaser Fallah and the PhD students in the Connected and Autonomous Vehicles Research Lab (CAVREL) on the perception (lane-finding, 3D object detection, etc.) components of connected self-driving vehicles.

work.title: Undergraduate Researcher
work.description: Worked under Dr. Swarup Bhunia and Prabuddha Chakraborty to develop and improve on a novel image compression algorithm using machine learning for triangulation acceleration via point prediction. ML model development was done in Python using Keras for prototyping, and color quantization and dequantization methods were implemented in C++.

work.title: Machine Learning Engineer Intern
work.description: Researched and implemented components of a machine learning pipeline for predicting user interest in products from a corpus of product descriptions. Tested, demonstrated, and reviewed viability of new machine learning development tools for approval of use within the Walt Disney Parks and Resorts (WDPR). Additionally developed tools for tokenization and user authentication into WDPR using Python and JavaScript.

skills.name: Machine Learning and Deep Learning methods

projects.title: Headstone Photo Processing System v2
projects.category: Headstone OCR with automatic cropping and database matching
